stories.original_title: MaliciousCorgi: AI Extensions send your code to China
stories.generated_headline: Malicious AI Code Assistants Exfiltrate Developer Data to China
stories.summary: Two VS Code extensions, disguised as AI-powered coding tools, have been found stealing sensitive developer data, including source code and credentials, and sending it to servers in China without users' knowledge.

stories.original_title: Actors: A Model of Concurrent Computation [pdf] (1985)
stories.generated_headline: Pioneering Concurrent Computation: The Actors Model Revisited
stories.summary: This seminal 1985 paper introduces the Actors model, a foundational framework for concurrent computation that has influenced decades of research and development in distributed systems and artificial intelligence. The model provides a fundamental understanding of parallel processing and communication.

stories.original_title: Claude Code is suddenly everywhere inside Microsoft
stories.generated_headline: Microsoft Integrates Anthropic's Claude Model into Core Products, Redefining AI Strategy
stories.summary: Microsoft's sudden adoption of Claude across its ecosystem signals a major shift in AI development, leveraging Anthropic's advanced capabilities to enhance enterprise offerings. This move positions Microsoft as a key player in the Claude ecosystem.

stories.original_title: Towards a science of scaling agent systems: When and why agent systems work
stories.generated_headline: Unlocking the Secrets of Scalable Agent Systems: A Scientific Approach
stories.summary: Researchers explore the fundamental principles behind the success of agent systems, shedding light on when and why these systems work, and paving the way for more efficient and effective AI applications.

stories.original_title: Show HN: My Open Source Deep Research tools beats Google and I can Prove it
stories.generated_headline: Open-Source Research Tool Claims to Outperform Google, Developer Seeks Feedback
stories.summary: A developer has released an open-source deep research tool, claiming it surpasses Google's search capabilities, and is now seeking community feedback to further improve the project. The tool's performance and potential impact on the search landscape are yet to be fully assessed.

stories.original_title: Are we dismissing AI spend before the 6x lands? (2025)
stories.generated_headline: AI Investment Trends: Are Enterprises Pulling Back Too Soon?
stories.summary: As AI capabilities approach a projected 6x increase in effectiveness, industry experts question whether current spending trends will sustain innovation momentum. Enterprises may be prematurely scaling back investments, risking a missed opportunity in transformative tech.

stories.original_title: Clearspace (YC W23) Is Hiring an Applied Researcher (ML)
stories.generated_headline: Clearspace Advances Space Sustainability with New Applied Researcher Hire
stories.summary: Clearspace, a Y Combinator-backed startup, is seeking an applied researcher to develop machine learning solutions for space debris removal and satellite management.

stories.original_title: Apple's MacBook Pro DFU port documentation is wrong
stories.generated_headline: Apple's MacBook Pro DFU Port Documentation Sparks Frustration Among Users
stories.summary: Apple's documentation for identifying the DFU port on MacBook Pro models with Apple silicon is incorrect, causing issues with firmware updates and external disk installations. The mistake has led to confusion and wasted time for users trying to update their Macs.

stories.original_title: MRI scans show exercise can make the brain look younger
stories.generated_headline: Exercise Linked to Enhanced Brain Health, Younger Brain Age in New MRI Study
stories.summary: Researchers have found that regular exercise may contribute to a younger-looking brain, with MRI scans revealing significant differences in brain structure between physically active and sedentary individuals. This groundbreaking study sheds new light on the role of physical activity in maintaining cognitive health.

stories.original_title: My fast zero-allocation webserver using OxCaml
stories.generated_headline: OCaml Powers High-Performance, Zero-Allocation Web Server
stories.summary: Researchers have successfully developed a fast web server using OCaml, a functional programming language, achieving zero memory allocation. This innovative approach promises to significantly improve web server performance and efficiency.

stories.original_title: Nano-vLLM: How a vLLM-style inference engine works
stories.generated_headline: Breaking Down Nano-vLLM: The Powerhouse Behind Efficient AI Inference
stories.summary: Nano-vLLM is revolutionizing the field of AI inference with its vLLM-style engine, offering unparalleled performance and efficiency. This cutting-edge technology is set to transform the way we deploy large language models.

stories.original_title: Show HN: NanoClaw – “Clawdbot” in 500 lines of TS with Apple container isolation
stories.generated_headline: Breakthrough in Compact Robotics: NanoClaw Redefines Autonomous Manipulation with Minimalist Code
stories.summary: NanoClaw, a 500-line TypeScript project, achieves Apple container isolation and showcases innovative robotics capabilities, challenging traditional notions of complex robotic systems.

stories.original_title: My iPhone 16 Pro Max produces garbage output when running MLX LLMs
stories.generated_headline: iPhone 16 Pro Max Struggles with MLX LLMs, Produces Garbage Output
stories.summary: A user reports issues with running large language models on their iPhone 16 Pro Max using MLX, resulting in poor output quality. This raises questions about the device's capabilities and optimization for AI tasks.

stories.original_title: Two kinds of AI users are emerging
stories.generated_headline: The Great Divide: Two Distinct Profiles of AI Adopters Take Shape
stories.summary: As AI adoption accelerates, users are splitting into two camps, each with distinct behaviors and expectations, reshaping the future of work and technology.

stories.original_title: Microsoft is walking back Windows 11's AI overload
stories.generated_headline: Microsoft Reverses Course on AI-Driven Windows 11 Features Amid User Backlash
stories.summary: Microsoft is scaling back its AI-powered features in Windows 11, responding to user feedback and concerns over the operating system's direction. The move signals a shift towards a more user-centric approach.

stories.original_title: Aging muscle stem cells shift from rapid repair to long-term survival
stories.generated_headline: Stem Cell Senescence: The Trade-Off Between Rapid Repair and Longevity
stories.summary: Researchers have discovered that aging muscle stem cells undergo a shift in priority from rapid tissue repair to long-term survival, revealing a complex trade-off between short-term functionality and cellular longevity. This finding has significant implications for the development of therapies targeting age-related muscle decline.

stories.original_title: "Solving" Wordle from Shared Scores at 100%* Accuracy
stories.generated_headline: Researchers Achieve Perfect Accuracy in Retrospectively Solving Wordle Puzzles from Shared Results
stories.summary: A new study demonstrates a method to accurately reconstruct Wordle solutions from publicly shared scorecards, raising questions about online security and game integrity.
